title: Post-Covid, Procurement Still Under-Resourced
summary: Companies are investing in technology to modernize their procurement departments, but many are not investing enough. Procurement departments are under-resourced and face several difficulties regarding funding, digital infrastructure and resource management. Despite these challenges, procurement is increasingly being pushed to the frontlines of navigating ongoing financial pressures.

title: Alarms will be sounding at Qantas, but not in the cockpit
summary: Qantas has declined in the World Airline Awards from 5th in 2022 to 24th in 2023. This is because of a series of bad news stories, including illegally sacking 1700 ground crew during the pandemic and selling seats on non-existent “ghost flights”. Qantas management has been accused of being more concerned about corporate profits and putting their own interests ahead of customers and staff.
greenwashing: The article does not provide enough information to determine whether the described product or process innovation is an example of greenwashing.

title: Part-Time MBA concentration in Strategy & Leadership
summary: This article is about the MBA program at the University of Phoenix and the various concentrations that students can choose from. It mentions that students in the Sustainability Management concentration can choose either the Strategy track or the Leadership track, each of which requires 12 credits of coursework. Strategic Management is also required for all students in this concentration.

title: The Best Rain Barrels of 2024
summary: This article discusses rain barrels used to collect rainwater for irrigation and other outdoor tasks. It recommends choosing a size and material based on your needs and local climate. Rainwater collection is regulated in some states, so check before installing a system.

title: Industrial Software Market worth $46.6 billion by 2029 - Exclusive Report by MarketsandMarkets
summary: The industrial software market is growing rapidly due to the adoption of Industry 4.0 technologies and the need to improve operational efficiency and agility. Industrial software solutions optimize production processes, reduce downtime, and improve productivity. The automotive and pharmaceutical industries are expected to be major drivers of growth for industrial software.

title: Alarms will be sounding at Qantas. Not in the cockpit, in the boardroom
summary: Qantas has been rapidly declining in the World Airline Awards, dropping from 5th in 2022 to 24th in 2023. The airline has been plagued by bad news stories, including illegally sacking 1700 ground crew during the pandemic and selling seats on non-existent “ghost flights”. The article suggests that this is due to the airline’s arrogant management team being more focused on corporate profits than on customers and staff.
greenwashing: The article does not mention greenwashing.
